node.title: SA parliament passes vote of no confidence in Deputy Premier Vickie Chapman
node.alt: SA Attorney-General Vickie Chapman stands in front of Christmas pageant equipment.
node.description: South Australia's parliament has passed a vote of no confidence in Deputy Premier Vickie Chapman.
node.content: ["South Australia's parliament has passed a vote of no confidence in Deputy Premier Vickie Chapman.", "It is the first time a minister has lost the confidence of the lower house.", "The vote came hours after a parliamentary inquiry recommended Ms Chapman be found guilty of contempt of parliament, for misleading the house.", "The inquiry also found Ms Chapman had a conflict of interest in exercising her power as Planning Minister to refuse a port on Kangaroo Island.", "Former Liberal MPs Sam Duluk and Troy Bell sided with fellow crossbenchers Frances Bedford and Geoff Brock and Labor to pass the no-confidence motion 23 votes to 22.", "Labor's original motion was amended to remove a clause calling upon the Premier to immediately sack Ms Chapman as a minister.", "However, the final motion calls upon the Speaker of the House, former Liberal Dan Cregan, to present the Governor Frances Adamson with a copy of the motion, expressing the House's will that Ms Chapman no longer serve as Deputy Premier and as a minister.", "More to come."]
